alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lonoke; Monroe (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 6:29PM CDT until June 25 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CLEVELAND...PRAIRIE...SOUTHERN LONOKE...MONROE... JEFFERSON...CENTRAL LINCOLN...SOUTHEASTERN PULASKI AND ARKANSAS COUNTIES... At 628 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Stuttgart Municipal Airport to near Brummitt to near Humphrey, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluff... Stuttgart... Lonoke... Star City... Clarendon... Hazen... De Valls Bluff... White Hall... England... Carlisle... Wrightsville... Redfield... Altheimer... Holly Grove... Humphrey... Grady... Fredonia... Humnoke... Almyra... Keo... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across southeast Lonoke County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
